numbered_ace_sentences: 1. At present, fossil fuels make up the majority of electricity generation.
2. At present, clean sources make up less electricity generation than fossil fuels.
3. In the past 2 decades, electricity usage has increased.
4. In the past 2 decades, electricity generation from unclean sources has increased.
5. In the past 2 decades, electricity generation from clean sources has remained the same.
6. I wonder how much more expensive it is to produce electricity from clean sources than from fossil fuels.
7. I wonder how much the switch from fossil-fuel electricity to clean electricity would cost.
8. This situation relates to me and my community.
9. Pollution from fossil fuels slowly ruins the quality of air in my community.
10. If the quality of air in my community is ruined, then the quality of life for me and my peers will be ruined.
11. This situation shows how much electricity is used globally.
12. This situation shows how fast global electricity usage has grown in the past 2 decades.
13. In surrounding towns, the production of energy is important.

15. The use of fossil fuels progresses the irreversible damage of global warming.
16. The headline is: Although ancient, fossil fuels remain relevant.
